member.name: T:Reversi.Model.SquareStatus
member.summary: The status of a square on the board.

remarks.para: The Empty, Dark and Light values are used to save a board, so they have the smallest values. The Outside and MoveableZone values are only use during a game.
This enum defines the MoveableZone that is a mark in addition to a normal status (here, the Empty.
The Outside value is used to simplify the algorithm to calculate the moves: the algorithm can stop moving into a direction when one of these square is found.

member.name: T:Reversi.Model.BoardTransform
member.summary: A board transformation.

remarks.para: As the Reversi board has no "preferential" direction (as in chess for example), the board can be rotated or have a line symmetry with the same position and the same best move. So a specific position has 8 different boards. This class defines the transforms that permits to get the original position from a transformed one.
The Null property is not defined in this class.
All the texts used by the class are taken from text resources files. The assembly defines the texts in English and in French. Other languages can be added with the text resources dictionary.
The texts resources are in the Reversi.BoardTransform group, with the name of the start position appended.
The values are defined in the nested class.
